dt: {bc}one of the hard bony structures set in sockets on the jaws of most vertebrates and used especially to chew and bite

{bc}to divide into two or more parts

{bc}to use less or do less of

dt: {bc}to knock down and wound or kill

dt: to use less or do less of

dt.t: The increase in supply costs {it}cut into{/it} their profit.

dt: {bc}to put or fix in a place or condition

dt.t: I {it}set{/it} the box on a table.

dt: {bc}to cause to be, become, or do

dt.t: You should {it}set{/it} an example for the others.
She ran to the front and {it}set{/it} the pace.

dt: {bc}to adjust or put in order for use

dt.t: He {it}sets{/it} his feet and takes aim.

dt: {bc}to arrange in a desired and especially a normal position
{bc}to become or cause to become firm or solid
{bc}to cover and warm eggs to hatch them
{bc}to provide (as words or verses) with music

dt.t: Though he lived nearby, I had never {it}set eyes on{/it} him.
They needed to leave arctic waters before winter {it}set in{/it}.
The phrase is {it}set off{/it} by commas.

dt: {bc}to begin on a course or journey

shortdef: to put or fix in a place or condition
to cause to be, become, or do

dt: {bc}to move or cause to move downward so as to be swallowed up
{bc}to fall or drop to a lower level

dt.t: They both {it}sank{/it} gratefully to the floor.

dt: {bc}the usually flexible outer layer of an animal body that in vertebrate animals is made up of two layers of cells forming an inner dermis and an outer epidermis
